at0104.comment: Da pro Studie eine Instanz dieses Archetyps verwendet wird, kann diese Identifikation verwendet werden, um mehr als eine Bildgebungsstudie in einem einzigen kompakten Bericht zu verbinden. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.

at0105.description: Vom radiologischen Dienst erstellte Beschreibung oder Klassifizierung der Studie.
at0105.comment: Entspricht ImagingStudy.description in FHIR und Study description (0008, 1030) in DICOM. Mögliche DICOM-Beispiele: MR BREAS, UNIT; NEURO^HEAD oder MR BREASTUNI UE.

at0106.description: Link zu vollständigen Details aller während der Studie durchgeführten Bildgebungen.
at0106.comment: Typischerweise wurden beim Referenzieren von Bildern die DICOM-fähigen Modalitäten verwendet, aber dieses Datenfeld bietet eine alternative Methode für den Zugriff auf die Bilder. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.imagingStudy in FHIR.

at0107.comment: Zum Beispiel: Zahnspangen, Gipsverbände, externe Fixierung.

at0108.description: Position/Lage der Person während der bildgebenden Untersuchung.

at0091.1.description: Die Art des Bildgebungsgeräts, -prozesses oder -verfahrens, das ursprünglich die Daten erfasst oder erzeugt hat, die zur Erstellung der Bilder in der Studie verwendet wurden.
at0091.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: „Röntgen“, „CT-Scan“, „Ultraschall“, „MRT“, „Knochendichtemessung“, „Tomografie“, „Mammografie“, „Nuklearmedizin“, „PET“, „Angiografie“ und „Fluoroskopie“. Dieses Datenelement kann redundant sein, wenn die Modalität eindeutig im „Name der Studie“ dargestellt wird. Alternativ ist es möglicherweise auch möglich, die „Modalität“ automatisch aus einem codierten „Name der Studie“ auszufüllen. Es wird empfohlen, die „Modalität“ mit einem Wertesatz zu codieren, z. B. mit dem Wertesatz DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality. Entspricht ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR und Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM.

at0092.1.description: Eindeutige Kennung für die vom Bildgebungsgerät zugewiesene Bildgebungsstudie.
at0092.1.comment: Entspricht der Study Instance UID (0020.000D) in DICOM und ImagingStudy.identifier in FHIR.

at0059.1.description: Vorschlag für weitere Bildgebung, Untersuchungen und/oder Überweisung und dazugehörige Begründung.
at0059.1.comment: Dieses Datenelement hat die Kardinalität 0..*, um mehr als eine Angabe von Empfehlung zu ermöglichen. Formelle Anordnungen für zusätzliche bildgebende Untersuchungen, Prüfungen sollten unter Verwendung eines INSTRUCTION-Archetyps wie INSTRUCTION.service_request dargestellt werden.

at0014.1.description: Die Beschreibung der relevanten klinischen Anamnese, die einen Kontext für die Untersuchung und Interpretation der Ergebnisse liefert.
at0014.1.comment: Alternativ kann dieses Datenelement einen RM-Link zu klinischen Informationen enthalten, die in der ursprünglichen Untersuchungsanfrage bereitgestellt wurden oder sich an anderer Stelle in der Gesundheitsakte befinden.

at0057.1.description: Die Beschreibung der Qualität der Untersuchung.
at0057.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: die Art jeglicher Einschränkungen und deren Auswirkung auf die Interpretation, Empfehlung zur Wiederholung der Untersuchung oder ob eine alternative Beurteilungsmethode geeigneter sein könnte.

at0058.1.description: Ein einzelnes Wort, eine Phrase oder eine kurze Beschreibung, die einen möglichen Zustand oder eine mögliche Diagnose darstellt.
at0058.1.comment: Dieses Datenelement kommt mehrfach vor, um mehr als eine Angabe von Differentialdiagnose zu ermöglichen. Wenn möglich, wird eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie wie SNOMED-CT bevorzugt. Dieses Datenelement ist als sich gegenseitig ausschließend zu „Bildgebende Diagnose“ zu betrachten, also jeweils nur entweder „Bildgebende Diagnose“ oder „Bildgebende Differentialdiagnose“ in einer Instanz des Archetyps „Bildgebendes Untersuchungsergebnis“.

at0097.1.description: Digitale Position der Vergleichsbildinhalte und Metadaten.
at0097.1.comment: Diese Position identifiziert den Netzwerkdienst, der den Zugriff (zum Speichern, Anzeigen, Abfragen oder Abrufen) für die Studie bereitstellt. Entspricht ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR.

at0098.1.description: Digitale Position der Bildinhalte und Metadaten.
at0098.1.comment: Diese Position identifiziert den Netzwerkdienst, der den Zugriff (zum Speichern, Anzeigen, Abfragen oder Abrufen) für die Studie bereitstellt. Entspricht ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR.

at0072.1.description: Der Status des Ergebnisses der bildgebenden Untersuchung als Ganzes.
at0072.1.comment: Die Werte wurden mit dem Status von Diagnostic report im FHIR abgeglichen, mit Ausnahme von „Entered in error“, das nur für ein datenaustausch-orientiertes Paradigma relevant ist. Andere lokale Codes/Begriffe können über die "Choice of" vom Text-Datentyp verwendet werden. In den meisten Anwendungsfällen ist jeweils nur ein Status anwendbar, jedoch erlaubt dieses Datenelement mehrere Vorkommen für die Anwendungsfälle, in denen eine Vielzahl von Status-Typen angegeben werden müssen, normalerweise innerhalb eines Templates. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.

at0071.1.description: Der Zeitpunkt, an dem der „Status des Gesamtergebnisses“ bestimm wurde.

at0055.1.description: Beschreibung der einfachen Körperstelle oder -region, die für die Bildgebung bestimmt ist.
at0055.1.comment: Wenn die Körperstelle im Text oder Code für „Name der Studie“ angegeben ist, kann dieses Feld überflüssig sein. Eine Codierung von „Zielgebiet“ mit einer Terminologie, wie z. B. SNOMED CT, ist wünschenswert. Entspricht ImagingStudy.series.bodySite in FHIR.

at0093.1.description: Details zu Bildern aus einer früheren Studie, die zum Vergleich mit der berichteten Studie verwendet wurden.

at0056.1.description: Die Beschreibung zum Vergleich dieser Untersuchung mit früheren ähnlichen Studien.
at0056.1.comment: Verwenden Sie dieses Datenelement auch, um anzugeben, ob keine Vergleichsbilder und/oder Berichte verfügbar sind. Details zu den zum Vergleich verwendeten Bildern können im CLUSTER „Vergleichstudie Details“ im Archetyp-Teil "Protocol" erfasst werden.

at0094.1.description: Der Name der durchgeführten bildgebenden Vergleichsuntersuchung.

at0031.1.description: Eindeutige Kennung für den Auftrag der bildgebenden Untersuchung, vergeben durch den radiologischen Dienst.
at0031.1.comment: Entspricht dem HL7 Filler Order Identifier oder dem DICOM Accession number attribute (0008,0050).

at0108.1.description: Position/Lage der Person während der bildgebenden Untersuchung.

at0105.1.description: Vom radiologischen Dienst erstellte Beschreibung oder Klassifizierung der Studie.
at0105.1.comment: Entspricht ImagingStudy.description in FHIR und Study description (0008, 1030) in DICOM. Mögliche DICOM-Beispiele: MR BREAS, UNIT; NEURO^HEAD oder MR BREASTUNI UE.

at0106.1.description: Link zu vollständigen Details aller während der Studie durchgeführten Bildgebungen.
at0106.1.comment: Typischerweise wurden beim Referenzieren von Bildern die DICOM-fähigen Modalitäten verwendet, aber dieses Datenfeld bietet eine alternative Methode für den Zugriff auf die Bilder. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.imagingStudy in FHIR.

at0104.1.description: Eindeutige Kennung für den vom Radiologiedienst vergebenen Bildgebungsbericht.
at0104.1.comment: Da pro Studie eine Instanz dieses Archetyps verwendet wird, kann diese Identifikation verwendet werden, um mehr als eine Bildgebungsstudie in einem einzigen kompakten Bericht zu verbinden. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.

at0002.1.description: Standardwert, ein undefinierter/s Zeitpunkt oder Intervallereignis, das explizit im Template oder zur Laufzeit der Anwendung definiert werden kann.

at0048.1.description: Die Beschreibung von Faktoren, welche noch nicht an anderer Stelle erfasst werden, die Untersuchungsbefunde und / oder -ergebnisse beeinflussen können.

at0049.1.description: Beschreibung des radiologischen Verfahrens, das zur Erfassung der Studie verwendet wurde.
at0049.1.comment: Verwenden Sie dieses Datenelement, um eine Zusammenfassung der technischen Prozedur zu beschreiben, einschließlich technischer Einschränkungen oder Abweichungen von den normalen technischen Verfahren. Zum Beispiel: "5-mm-Axialbilder von den Lungenbasen durch die Schambeinfuge wurden nach Verabreichung von intravenösem und oralem Kontrastmittel aufgenommen. Aus den Quelldaten wurden koronale und sagittale neu formatierte Bilder erstellt."

at0004.1.description: Der Name der durchgeführten bildgebenden Untersuchung.
at0004.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: „CT Abdomen“, „Doppler-Ultraschall der Nierenarterie“ oder „Röntgenaufnahme des Brustkorbs“. Es wird dringend empfohlen, eine Terminologie zu verwenden, vorzugsweise einen Begriff, der sowohl die Modalität als auch die anatomische Lokalisation angibt, sofern möglich. Beispiele für mögliche Terminologien sind die LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook oder SNOMED-CT. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR.

at0027.1.description: Angaben zur Anforderung einer einzelnen bildgebenden Untersuchung.

at0006.1.description: Strukturierte Angaben über die Körperstelle oder -region, die für die Bildgebung bestimmt ist.
at0006.1.comment: Wenn die Körperstelle durch einen Code im "Name der Studie" angegeben wird, kann dieses Datenelement überflüssig sein.

at0029.1.comment: Dies kann in Situationen nützlich sein, in denen die angeforderte Untersuchung von der durchgeführten Untersuchung abweicht.

at0028.1.description: Eindeutige Kennung für den Auftrag der bildgebenden Untersuchung, vom Anforderer vergeben.
at0028.1.comment: Entspricht der HL7 Placer Order Identifier.

at0008.1.description: Die Beschreibung oder Zusammenfassung aller klinischen Ergebnisse.

at0063.1.description: Die Beurteilung der Qualität der Untersuchung.
at0063.1.comment: Es wird empfohlen, die Qualität der Bildgebung mit einer Wertemenge zu codieren. Zum Beispiel: „ausgezeichnet, gut, mittelmäßig, schlecht und nicht diagnostisch“ oder „angemessen, suboptimal und unzureichend“.

at0087.1.description: Name des radiologischen Verfahrens, das zur Erfassung der Studie verwendet wurde.
at0087.1.comment: Die Codierung des „Technischen Verfahrens“ mit einer Terminologie ist erlaubt. Mehrere Vorkommen ermöglichen die Identifizierung einer oder mehrerer Techniken.

at0062.1.description: Beschreibung des klinischen Verfahrens oder andere klinische Aspekte, die zur Erfassung der Studie verwendet wurden.
at0062.1.comment: Verwenden Sie dieses Datenelement, um eine Zusammenfassung des klinischen Verfahrens, der Patientenpositionierung, Eingriffe wie Valsalva-Manöver und der Verabreichung von Kontrastmitteln, Radiopharmaka und/oder Behandlungen als Teil der Bildgebungsstudie zu beschreiben. Zum Beispiel: „80 ml Isovue-370 wurden intravenös unter Verwendung einer Bolus-Tracking-Technik verabreicht, die auf die Hauptpulmonalarterie zentriert war“. Es kann auch verwendet werden, um einen Überblick über aufgetretene Probleme, Komplikationen oder Nebenwirkungen darzustellen.

at0061.1.description: Die Beschreibung des Grundes für die ursprüngliche Untersuchungsanfrage.
at0061.1.comment: Auch bekannt als „Klinische Fragestellung“ oder „Klinische Frage“.

at0088.1.description: Identifizierung des klinischen Verfahrens oder Managements, das zur Erfassung der Studie verwendet wurde.

at0021.1.description: Kurz beschriebene, klinisch relevante Interpretation aller bildgebenden Befunde und gegebenenfalls ein Vergleich zu früheren Studien.
at0021.1.comment: Auch als „Beurteilung“ oder „Gesamteindruck“ bezeichnet. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR.

at0044.1.description: Strukturierte Informationen zu den bildgebenden Befunden, die auf eine bestimmte Körperstruktur oder -region abzielen.

at0020.1.description: Ein einzelnes Wort, eine Phrase oder eine kurze Beschreibung, die einen wahrscheinlichen Zustand oder eine wahrscheinliche Diagnose darstellt.
at0020.1.comment: Dieses Datenelement kommt mehrfach vor, um mehr als eine Diagnose zu ermöglichen. Wenn möglich, wird eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie wie SNOMED CT bevorzugt. Dieses Datenelement ist als sich gegenseitig ausschließend zur „Bildgebenden Differenzialdiagnostik“ zu betrachten, dh jeweils nur entweder „Bildgebende Diagnostik“ oder „Bildgebende Differenzialdiagnostik“ des Archetyps „Bildgebendes Untersuchungsergebnis“. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR.

at0000.1.description: Ergebnis einer bildgebenden Untersuchung, die an einer Person mit radiologischen Verfahren durchgeführt wird.

at0023.1.description: Zusätzliche Informationen über die Untersuchung, welche noch nicht an anderer Stelle dargestellt wurden.
at0023.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: eine Anmerkung, dass der Film dem Patienten gegeben wurde. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR.

at0000.description: *The result of an imaging examination performed on an individual, using radiological techniques. (en)

at0002.description: Förinställd, ospecificerad tidpunkt eller tidsintervall som kan definieras mer uttryckligen i en mall (template) eller i en applikation.

at0003.description: @ internal @

at0004.description: *The name of the imaging examination performed. (en)
at0004.comment: *For example: 'CT abdomen'; 'Doppler ultrasound of renal artery' or 'Plain chest xray'. Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook or SNOMED-CT. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR. (en)

at0006.description: *Structured detail about the body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0006.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. (en)

at0008.description: *Narrative description or overview of all clinical findings. (en)

at0014.description: *Narrative description of relevant clinical history that provides context for the examination and interpretation of results. (en)
at0014.comment: *Alternatively this data element can include an RM link to clinical information provided in the original examination request or located elsewhere within the health record. (en)

at0020.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar det troliga tillståndet eller diagnosen.
at0020.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging differential diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR. (en)

at0021.description: Kortfattad och kliniskt relevant tolkning av alla bilddiagnostiska fynd, inklusive en jämförelse med tidigare studier där så är lämpligt.
at0021.comment: *Also referred to as 'Opinion' or 'Conclusion'. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR. (en)

at0023.description: Ytterligare beskrivning av undersökningen som inte fångats i andra fält.
at0023.comment: *For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR. (en)

at0025.description: @ internal @

at0026.description: *Details about the service, organisation or individual carrying out the imaging examination. (en)

at0027.description: *Details about a single imaging examination requested. (en)

at0028.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging examination order assigned by the requester. (en)
at0028.comment: *Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier. (en)

at0029.comment: *This can be usefule in situations where the examination requested differs from the examination performed. (en)

at0030.description: *Details about the clinician and/or organisation requesting the imaging examination. (en)

at0031.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging examination order assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0031.comment: *Equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier or DICOM Accession number attribute (0008,0050). (en)

at0041.description: *Additional structured details of technical and clinical aspects of capturing the image/s. (en)

at0044.description: *Structured details about the imaging examination findings targeting a specific structure or region. (en)

at0045.comment: *Multiple formats are allowed but they should represent equivalent clinical content. For example a pdf version of the report. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.presentedForm in FHIR. (en)

at0046.description: Ytterligare information som krävs för att utvidga modellen med lokalt innehåll eller för anpassning till andra referensmodeller.
at0046.comment: Till exempel: lokala informationskrav eller ytterligare metadata för anpassning till FHIR.

at0048.description: Beskrivning av faktorer som inte registrerats någon annanstans, men som kan påverka fynden och/eller undersökningsresultatet.

at0049.description: *Narrative description about the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0049.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of technique, including technical limitations or deviation from the normal technical procedures. For example: '5 mm axial images from the lung bases through the pubic symphysis were acquired following the administration of intravenous and oral contrast. Coronal and Sagittal reformatted images were constructed from the source data.' (en)

at0055.description: *Description of the simple body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0055.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. Coding of 'Target body site' with a terminology, such as SNOMED CT, is desirable. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.series.bodySite in FHIR. (en)

at0056.description: *Narrative description about the comparison of this examination with previous similar studies. (en)
at0056.comment: *Also use this data element to indicate if no comparison images and/or reports are available. Details about the images used for comparison can be recorded using the 'Comparison study details' CLUSTER, within Protocol. (en)

at0057.description: *Narrative description about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0057.comment: *For example: the nature of any limitations and their impact on interpretation; recommendation that the examination should be repeated; or whether an alternative method of assessment might be more appropriate. (en)

at0058.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar ett möjligt tillstånd eller en diagnos.
at0058.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." (en)

at0059.description: Förslag för ytterligare avbildning, undersökningar och/eller hänvisning och tillhörande motiv.
at0059.comment: *This data element has 0..* occurrences to allow for more than one recommendation. Formal orders for additional imaging examination, investigation should be recorded using an INSTRUCTION archetype, such as INSTRUCTION.service_request. (en)

at0061.description: *Narrative description about the reason the examination was originally requested. (en)

at0062.description: *Narrative description about the clinical procedure or other clinical considerations used to capture the study. (en)
at0062.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of the clinical procedure, patient positioning, interventions such as Valsalva manoeuvre, and administration of contrast agent, radiopharmaceuticals and/or treatments as part of the imaging study. For example: '80 ml of Isovue-370 was administered intravenously using a bolus-tracking technique centered on the main pulmonary artery'. It can also be used to record an overview of any issues, complications or adverse reactions encountered.  (en)

at0063.description: *Assessment about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0063.comment:
*Coding of the imaging quality with a value set is recommended. For example: 'excellent, good, fair, poor, and non-diagnostic'; or 'adequate, suboptimal and inadequate'.
 (en)

at0065.description: *Details about a series included in this report. (en)

at0067.description: *Details about an imaging series being compared to the reported study. (en)

at0069.description: *Details about imaging device/s used to capture the study. (en)

at0070.description: *Date/time when the imaging started. (en)

at0071.description: *The date and/or time that ‘Overall result status’ was assigned. (en)

at0072.description: *The status of the imaging examination result as a whole. (en)
at0072.comment: *The values have been aligned with the FHIR Diagnostic report status, with the exception of 'Entered in error' which is relevant only to a messaging-oriented paradigm. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'. In most use cases, only one status is applicable at any time, however this data element allows multiple occurrences for the use cases where there are a variety of types of status that need to be specified, usually within a template. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.  (en)

at0073.description: *The existence of the study is registered, but no result is yet available. (en)

at0074.description: *This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) result but data may be incomplete or unverified. (en)

at0075.description: Verified early results are available, but not all results are final. This is a sub-category of 'Partial'.

at0076.description: *The result is complete and verified by an authorised person. (en)

at0077.description: *Subsequent to being final, the result has been modified. (en)

at0078.description: *Subsequent to being final, the result has been modified to correct an error. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'. (en)

at0079.description: *Subsequent to being final, the result has been modified by adding new content. The existing content is unchanged. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'. (en)

at0080.description: The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').

at0083.description: *Details of additional clinicians or organisations who require a copy of the examination result. (en)
at0083.comment: The 'Distribution list' is for information-only, and that the primary recipient of the report is the person intended to act on the information.

at0087.description: *Name of the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0087.comment: *Coding of the 'Technique' with a terminology is permitted. Multiple occurrences allow for identification of one or more techniques. (en)

at0088.description: *Identification of the clinical procedure or management used to capture the study. (en)

at0090.description: *The status of the result is not known. (en)

at0091.description: *The type of imaging device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the images in the study. (en)
at0091.comment: *For example: 'XRay', 'CT scan', 'ultrasound', 'MRI', 'bone densitometry', 'tomography', 'mammography', 'nuclear medicine', 'PET', 'angiography', and 'fluoroscopy'. This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended, such as the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM. (en)

at0092.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging study assigned by the imaging device. (en)
at0092.comment: *Equivalent to Study Instance UID (0020,000D) in DICOM and ImagingStudy.identifier in FHIR. (en)

at0093.description: *Details about images from a prior study used for comparison to the reported study. (en)

at0094.description: *The name of the comparison imaging examination performed. (en)

at0095.description: *Unique identifier for the comparison imaging study. (en)

at0096.description: *Date and time the comparison examination started. (en)

at0097.description: *Digital location of the comparison imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0097.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0098.description: *Digital location of the imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0098.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0099.description: *The current state of the imaging study. (en)

at0100.description: *The existence of the imaging study is registered, but there is nothing yet available. (en)

at0101.description: *At least one instance has been associated with this imaging study. (en)

at0102.description: *The imaging study is unavailable because the study was not started or not completed. (en)

at0103.description: *The status is not known by the radiology source system. (en)

at0104.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging report assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0104.comment: *As one instance of this archetype is used per study, this identifier can be used to connect more than one imaging study within a single combined report. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.  (en)

at0105.description: *Radiology service-generated description or classification of the study. (en)
at0105.comment: *Equivalent to ImagingStudy.description in FHIR and Study description (0008, 1030) in DICOM. Possible DICOM examples: MR BREAS, UNIT; NEURO^HEAD; or MR BREASTUNI UE. (en)

at0106.description: *Link to full details of any imaging carried out during the study. (en)
at0106.comment: *Typically referencing images used the DICOM enabled modalities, but this data field provides an alternative method to access the images. Equivalent to FHIR's DiagnosticReport.imagingStudy. (en)

at0107.description: *Identification of a stabilising appliance in use. (en)

at0108.description: *Position of the individual during the imaging examination. (en)

at0091.1.comment: *For example: 'XRay', 'CT scan', 'ultrasound', 'MRI', 'bone densitometry', 'tomography', 'mammography', 'nuclear medicine', 'PET', 'angiography', and 'fluoroscopy'. This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended, such as the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM. (en)

at0092.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging study assigned by the imaging device. (en)
at0092.1.comment: *Equivalent to Study Instance UID (0020,000D) in DICOM and ImagingStudy.identifier in FHIR. (en)

at0059.1.description: Förslag för ytterligare avbildning, undersökningar och/eller hänvisning och tillhörande motiv.
at0059.1.comment: *This data element has 0..* occurrences to allow for more than one recommendation. Formal orders for additional imaging examination, investigation should be recorded using an INSTRUCTION archetype, such as INSTRUCTION.service_request. (en)

at0014.1.description: *Narrative description of relevant clinical history that provides context for the examination and interpretation of results. (en)
at0014.1.comment: *Alternatively this data element can include an RM link to clinical information provided in the original examination request or located elsewhere within the health record. (en)

at0057.1.description: *Narrative description about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0057.1.comment: *For example: the nature of any limitations and their impact on interpretation; recommendation that the examination should be repeated; or whether an alternative method of assessment might be more appropriate. (en)

at0058.1.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar ett möjligt tillstånd eller en diagnos.
at0058.1.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." (en)

at0097.1.description: *Digital location of the comparison imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0097.1.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0098.1.description: *Digital location of the imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0098.1.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0072.1.description: *The status of the imaging examination result as a whole. (en)
at0072.1.comment: *The values have been aligned with the FHIR Diagnostic report status, with the exception of 'Entered in error' which is relevant only to a messaging-oriented paradigm. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'. In most use cases, only one status is applicable at any time, however this data element allows multiple occurrences for the use cases where there are a variety of types of status that need to be specified, usually within a template. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.  (en)

at0099.1.description: *The current state of the imaging study. (en)

at0071.1.description: *The date and/or time that ‘Overall result status’ was assigned. (en)

at0055.1.description: *Description of the simple body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0055.1.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. Coding of 'Target body site' with a terminology, such as SNOMED CT, is desirable. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.series.bodySite in FHIR. (en)

at0093.1.description: *Details about images from a prior study used for comparison to the reported study. (en)

at0056.1.description: *Narrative description about the comparison of this examination with previous similar studies. (en)
at0056.1.comment: *Also use this data element to indicate if no comparison images and/or reports are available. Details about the images used for comparison can be recorded using the 'Comparison study details' CLUSTER, within Protocol. (en)

at0094.1.description: *The name of the comparison imaging examination performed. (en)

at0031.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging examination order assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0031.1.comment: *Equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier or DICOM Accession number attribute (0008,0050). (en)

at0095.1.description: *Unique identifier for the comparison imaging study. (en)

at0096.1.description: *Date and time the comparison examination started. (en)

at0108.1.description: *Position of the individual during the imaging examination. (en)

at0105.1.description: *Radiology service-generated description or classification of the study. (en)
at0105.1.comment: *Equivalent to ImagingStudy.description in FHIR and Study description (0008, 1030) in DICOM. Possible DICOM examples: MR BREAS, UNIT; NEURO^HEAD; or MR BREASTUNI UE. (en)

at0106.1.description: *Link to full details of any imaging carried out during the study. (en)
at0106.1.comment: *Typically referencing images used the DICOM enabled modalities, but this data field provides an alternative method to access the images. Equivalent to FHIR's DiagnosticReport.imagingStudy. (en)

at0104.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging report assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0104.1.comment: *As one instance of this archetype is used per study, this identifier can be used to connect more than one imaging study within a single combined report. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.  (en)

at0002.1.description: Förinställd, ospecificerad tidpunkt eller tidsintervall som kan definieras mer uttryckligen i en mall (template) eller i en applikation.

at0048.1.description: Beskrivning av faktorer som inte registrerats någon annanstans, men som kan påverka fynden och/eller undersökningsresultatet.

at0049.1.description: *Narrative description about the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0049.1.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of technique, including technical limitations or deviation from the normal technical procedures. For example: '5 mm axial images from the lung bases through the pubic symphysis were acquired following the administration of intravenous and oral contrast. Coronal and Sagittal reformatted images were constructed from the source data.' (en)

at0004.1.description: *The name of the imaging examination performed. (en)
at0004.1.comment: *For example: 'CT abdomen'; 'Doppler ultrasound of renal artery' or 'Plain chest xray'. Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook or SNOMED-CT. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR. (en)

at0027.1.description: *Details about a single imaging examination requested. (en)

at0006.1.description: *Structured detail about the body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0006.1.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. (en)

at0029.1.comment: *This can be usefule in situations where the examination requested differs from the examination performed. (en)

at0028.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging examination order assigned by the requester. (en)
at0028.1.comment: *Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier. (en)

at0008.1.description: *Narrative description or overview of all clinical findings. (en)

at0063.1.description: *Assessment about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0063.1.comment:
*Coding of the imaging quality with a value set is recommended. For example: 'excellent, good, fair, poor, and non-diagnostic'; or 'adequate, suboptimal and inadequate'.
 (en)

at0087.1.description: *Name of the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0087.1.comment: *Coding of the 'Technique' with a terminology is permitted. Multiple occurrences allow for identification of one or more techniques. (en)

at0062.1.description: *Narrative description about the clinical procedure or other clinical considerations used to capture the study. (en)
at0062.1.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of the clinical procedure, patient positioning, interventions such as Valsalva manoeuvre, and administration of contrast agent, radiopharmaceuticals and/or treatments as part of the imaging study. For example: '80 ml of Isovue-370 was administered intravenously using a bolus-tracking technique centered on the main pulmonary artery'. It can also be used to record an overview of any issues, complications or adverse reactions encountered.  (en)

at0061.1.description: *Narrative description about the reason the examination was originally requested. (en)

at0088.1.description: *Identification of the clinical procedure or management used to capture the study. (en)

at0021.1.description: Kortfattad och kliniskt relevant tolkning av alla bilddiagnostiska fynd, inklusive en jämförelse med tidigare studier där så är lämpligt.
at0021.1.comment: *Also referred to as 'Opinion' or 'Conclusion'. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR. (en)

at0044.1.description: *Structured details about the imaging examination findings targeting a specific structure or region. (en)

at0020.1.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar det troliga tillståndet eller diagnosen.
at0020.1.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging differential diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR. (en)

at0000.1.description: *The result of an imaging examination performed on an individual, using radiological techniques. (en)

at0023.1.description: Ytterligare beskrivning av undersökningen som inte fångats i andra fält.
at0023.1.comment: *For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR. (en)

de.purpose: Zur Identifikation und Dokumentation von strukturierten Daten bezüglich einer bestimmten Körperstelle oder innerhalb des menschlichen Körpers, unter Verwendung makroskopischer anatomischer Fachbegriffe.
de.use:
Zur Dokumentation von strukturierten und konsistenten Details eines einzelnen bestimmten physischen Bereich innerhalb des menschlichen Körpers verwenden.

Dieser Archetyp wurde speziell für die Verwendung im Rahmen von allen geeigneten ENTRY- oder CLUSTER-Archetypen entwickelt, die den Kontext des anatomischen Fundortes liefern.

Als grundlegender Bestandteil der klinischen Praxis, können Mediziner anatomische Lokalisationen auf einer Vielzahl von komplexen und variablen Wegen definieren. In der Praxis tragen einige Archetypen ein einziges Datenelement für eine einfache Beschreibung der Körperstelle - zum Beispiel OBSERVATION.blood_pressure und CLUSTER.symptom bei der Beschreibung von Ohrenschmerzen. In dieser Situation, in der die Wertemenge berechenbar und simpel zu definieren ist, ist dieses einzelne Datenelement eine sehr genaue und pragmatische Möglichkeit, die Stelle im Körper zu protokollieren und zu einem späteren Zeitpunkt abzufragen. In der Situation, in der die anatomische Lage nicht genau definiert ist oder zur Laufzeit bestimmt werden muss, kann es flexibler sein, diesen strukturierten Archetyp zu verwenden. Wenn zum Beispiel jedes Symptom ohne einen vordefinierten Umfang der Symptomatik aufgezeichnet werden kann, dann ist es sinnvoll, diesen Archetyp zu verwenden, um eine spezifische anatomische Lokalisation im Körper zu definieren. In diesem Fall trägt der CLUSTER.symptom Archetyp auch einen SLOT für 'Detaillierte anatomische Lokalisation', der diesen Archetyp enthalten kann, um maximale Flexibilität bei der Erfassung der Daten zur anatomischen Lage zu gewährleisten.

Dieser Archetyp unterstützt die Aufnahme von komplex strukturierten anatomischen Stellen. Beispielsweise findet sich der Scheitelpunkt des Herzens typischerweise am fünften linken Interkostalraum in der Mittelklavikularlinie, Schmerzempfindlichkeit am McBurney-Punkt an der Bauchdecke oder eine Risswunde an der Handflächeninnenseite des proximalen rechten Daumens.

Eine Kombination der Datenelemente in diesem Archetyp kann verwendet werden, um jede Komponente eines postkoordinierten Terminologieausdrucks, der den anatomischen Bereich repräsentiert, individuell zu dokumentieren.

Der SLOT "Alternative Struktur" erlaubt die Aufnahme zusätzlicher Archetypen, die eine alternative Struktur zur Beschreibung derselben Körperstelle bieten, wie z.B. CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative oder CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock, falls dies benötigt wird. Wenn dieser Archetyp nur zur Benennung eines großen und/oder unspezifischen Körperteils verwendet werden kann, unterstützt die zusätzliche Verwendung des Archetyps CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative die Aufnahme einer genaueren Position - zum Beispiel 2 cm vor der kubitalen Fossa des linken Unterarms oder 4 cm unter dem Rippenrand an der Brustwand in der Mittelklavikularlinie.

Wenn dieser Archetyp in anderen Archetypen verwendet wird, in denen das angegebene Thema nicht die Person ist, für die der Datensatz erstellt wird, z.B. ein Fötus in-utero, dann wird der anatomische Ort eine Körperstelle auf oder innerhalb des Fötus identifizieren."
de.misuse: Nicht zur Angabe von unilateralen/bilateralen Vorkommen eines anatomischen Merkmals verwenden.

sv.purpose: Att identifiera och registrera strukturerade detaljer om ett enskilt fysiskt ställe, på eller i människokroppen genom att använda makroskopiska anatomiska termer.
sv.use:
Används för att strukturerat och konsekvent registrera detaljer om ett enskilt fysiskt ställe på eller i människokroppen.

Arketypen är specifikt utformad för att användas i lämpliga ENTRY- och CLUSTER-arketyper som sätter den anatomiska lokalisationen i ett sammanhang.

Som en grundläggande del av klinisk praxis kan kliniker beskriva anatomiska platser på en mängd olika sätt. Vissa arketyper innehåller ett enskilt dataelement för beskrivning av en anatomisk plats - till exempel OBSERVATION.blood_pressure och CLUSTER.symptoms när man beskriver smärta i örat. I situationer, där urvalet är förutsägbart och lätt att definiera, är detta enkla dataelement ett mycket exakt och praktiskt sätt att registrera en anatomisk plats och söka efter den vid ett senare tillfälle. När den anatomiska platsen inte är väldefinierad eller behöver genereras automatiskt av IT- system, kan det vara mer flexibelt att använda denna strukturerade arketyp. Till exempel, i en situation där symptom ska registreras utan fördefinierad omfattning om vilka typer av symptom det kan vara, kan denna arketyp vara användbar för att definiera en anatomisk plats i kroppen. I det här fallet har CLUSTER.symptom-arketypen en SLOT för detaljerad anatomisk lokalisation som kan innehålla denna arketyp för att stödja maximal flexibilitet vid registrering av anatomisk lokalisation.

Arketypen stöder registrering av komplexa strukturerade anatomiska platser. Till exempel finns hjärtspetsstöten typiskt i mitralområdet, ömhet vid McBurneys punkt på bukväggen eller sårskada på handflatan av den proximala högra tummen.

En kombination av dataelement i den här arketypen kan användas för att registrera varje komponent i ett postkoordinerat terminologiskt uttryck som representerar den anatomiska platsen. 

SLOT ‘Alternativt struktur’ möjliggör inkludering av ytterligare arketyper som ger en alternativ struktur för att beskriva samma anatomisk plats, så som CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative eller CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock, om detta skulle krävas. I situationen där denna arketyp kan användas endast för att namnge en stor och/eller ej specifik kroppsdel, kan användning av CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative arketyp stödja registrering av mer exakt anatomisk plats – till exempel , 2cm anteriort från fossa cubitalis på vänster arm eller 4 cm under revbensbågen i medioklavikularlinjen på bröstväggen.

Om denna arketyp används inom andra arketyper där patienten inte är den individen för vilken dokumentation skapas, till exempel ett foster i livmodern, används denna arketyp för att identifiera en anatomisk plats på eller i fostret.
sv.misuse: Används inte för att specificera unilaterala/bilaterala förekomster av ett anatomiskt särdrag

nb.purpose: For registering av strukturerte detaljer om én enkelt makroskopisk fysisk lokalisering på eller i menneskekroppen.
nb.use:
Brukes for å dokumentere strukturerte og ensartede detaljer om et enkelt identifisert fysisk sted på eller i menneskekroppen.

Denne arketypen er spesifikt designet for bruk i ENTRY og CLUSTER-arketyper som gir konteksten for den anatomiske lokaliseringen.

Som en grunnleggende del av klinisk praksis kan klinikere beskrive anatomiske lokaliseringer på et utall forskjellige måter. Noen arketyper inneholder et enkelt dataelement for enkel beskrivelse av en kroppslig lokalisering - for eksempel OBSERVATION.blood_pressure, og CLUSTER.symptom når man beskriver øresmerter. I denne situasjonen, hvor verdisettet er forutsigbart og enkelt å definere, er dette enkle dataelementet en meget nøyaktig og praktisk måte for å registrere et anatomisk sted på eller i kroppen og søke på det på et senere tidspunkt. Når den anatomiske lokaliseringen derimot ikke er veldefinert eller må defineres fortløpende, kan det være mer fleksibelt å bruke denne strukturerte arketypen. For eksempel i en situasjon hvor et hvilket som helst symptom kan bli registrert uten noen forkunnskaper om hvilke typer symptomer det kan være, så vil muligheten for å bruke denne arketypen være nyttig. I dette tilfellet har CLUSTER.symptom-arketypen et SLOT for "Strukturert anatomisk lokalisering" som kan inneholde denne arketypen for å støtte maksimal fleksibilitet i registrering av data om den anatomiske lokaliseringen.

Arketypen støtter registrering av komplekse strukturerte anatomiske steder. For eksempel finnes hjertespisstøt typisk i femte venstre intercostalrom i midtclaviculære linjen, ømhet ved McBurney's punkt på abdomen eller laserasjon på den palmare siden av den proksimale høyre tommelen.

En kombinasjon av dataelementer i denne arketypen kan brukes for individuell registrering av hver komponent av et postkoordinert terminologiuttrykk for anatomisk sted.

Arketypen inneholder et "Alternativ struktur" SLOT som tillater inklusjon av ytterligere arketyper som gir en alternativ struktur for beskrivelse av det samme kroppssted, som CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative eller CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock om dette er nødvendig. I en situasjon hvor denne arketypen bare brukes til å navngi en større og/eller ikke-spesifikk kroppsdel, kan ytterligere bruk av CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative-arketypen understøtte registrering av en mer presis lokasjon - for eksempel 2 cm anteriort for venstre arms cubitalfossa eller 4 cm under høyre costamargin på brystveggen i midtclaviculærlinjen.

Hvis denne arketypen brukes i andre arketyper hvor pasienten/klienten ikke er den som dokumentasjonen omhandler, for eksempel foetus-in-utero, så vil den anatomiske lokaliseringen bli identifisert som en lokalisering på eller i kroppen til fosteret.
nb.misuse: Brukes ikke for spesifisering av unilateral/bilateral forekomst av et anatomisk kjennetegn.

pt-br.purpose: Para identificar e anotar informações estruturadas sobre um único local físico do corpo humano usando termos anatômicos macroscópicos.
pt-br.use:
Use para gravar detalhes estruturados e consistentes sobre um único local físico identificado do corpo humano.

Este arquétipo foi projetado especificamente para ser utilizado dentro do contexto de qualquer entrada ou CLUSTER arquétipo que forneça o contexto da localização anatômica.

Como uma parte fundamental da prática clínica, os médicos podem descrever localizações anatômicas em uma miríade de formas complexas e variáveis. Na prática, alguns arquétipos carregam um elemento de dados único para o transporte de uma simples descrição do local do corpo - por exemplo, OBSERVATION.blood_pressure e CLUSTER.symptom quando descrevem a dor de ouvido. Nesta situação, onde o valor definido é previsível e simples de definir, este elemento de dados único é uma maneira muito precisa e pragmática para gravar o local no corpo e a consulta em uma data posterior. No entanto na situação onde a localização anatômica não é bem definida ou precisa ser determinada em tempo de execução, pode ser mais flexível para usar este arquétipo estruturado. Por exemplo, na situação onde qualquer sintoma pode ser gravado sem qualquer escopo predefinido do tipo, em seguida, permitindo o uso deste arquétipo especificamente, definir uma localização anatômica do corpo pode ser útil. Neste caso, o arquétipo CLUSTER.symptom carrega também um SLOT para localização anatômica detalhada que inclui este arquétipo para oferecer suporte a máxima flexibilidade na gravação de dados da localização anatômica.

Este arquétipo suporta gravação de locais anatômicos estruturados complexos. Por exemplo, a batida do ápice do coração é normalmente encontrada no quinto espaço intercostal esquerdo na linha médio-clavicular, ou a sensibilidade em ponto de McBurneys na parede abdominal ou laceração na face palmar do polegar direito proximal.

Uma combinação de elementos de dados neste arquétipo pode ser usado para gravar individualmente cada componente de uma expressão de terminologia coordenada que representa o site anatômico.

A estrutura alternativa SLOT permite a inclusão de arquétipos adicionais que fornecem uma estrutura alternativa para descrever o mesmo local do corpo, como CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative ou CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock, esta deve ser exigida. Na situação onde este arquétipo só pode ser usado para nomear uma parte do corpo e/ou não-específica, o uso adicional do arquétipo CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative oferecerá suporte a gravação de uma localização mais precisa - por exemplo, 2 cm anterior da fossa cubital do antebraço esquerdo ou 4 cm abaixo da margem costal de R na parede torácica na linha médio-clavicular.

Se este arquétipo é usado dentro de outros arquétipos onde o assunto especificado de cuidados não é o indivíduo para quem o registro está sendo criado, por exemplo um feto em útero, então a localização anatômica vai estar realizada identificando um local do corpo ou com o feto.
pt-br.misuse: Não deve ser usado para especificar as ocorrências unilateral/bilateral de uma característica anatômica.

ar-sy.misuse: لا يستخدم لتحديد حالات الحدوث في جانب واحد أو في الجانبين - حيث إن ذلك متعلق بتقييم قد يتضمن العديد من الأماكن

sl.misuse: *Not for specifiying unilateral/bilateral occurence - this is related to an evaluation which perhaps includes multiple locations.(en)

en.purpose: To identify and record structured details about a single physical site on, or within, the human body using macroscopic anatomical terms.
en.use:
Use to record structured and consistent details about a single identified physical site on, or within, the human body. 

This archetype is specifically designed to be used within the context of any appropriate ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes which supply the context of the anatomical location. 

As a fundamental part of clinical practice, clinicians can describe anatomical locations in a myriad of complex and variable ways. In practice, some archetypes carry a single data element for carrying a simple description of body site - for example, OBSERVATION.blood_pressure and CLUSTER.symptom when describing ear pain. In this situation, where the value set is predictable and simple to define, this single data element is a very accurate and pragmatic way to record the site in the body and to query at a later date. However in the situation where the anatomical location is not well defined or needs to be determined at run-time, it may be more flexible to use this structured archetype. For example, in the situation where any symptom can be recorded without any predefined scope of the type of symptom, then allowing the use of this archetype to specifically define an anatomical location in the body may be useful. In this case the CLUSTER.symptom archetype also carries a SLOT for 'Detailed anatomical location' which can include this archetype to support maximal flexibility in recording anatomical location data.

This archetype supports recording complex structured anatomical sites. For example, the apex beat of the heart is typically found at the fifth left intercostal space in the mid-clavicular line, tenderness at McBurney's point on the abdominal wall or a laceration on the palmar aspect of the proximal right thumb.

A combination of the data elements in this archetype can be used to individually record each component of a postcoordinated terminology expression that represents the anatomical site.

The 'Alternative structure' SLOT allows inclusion of additional archetypes that provide an alternative structure for describing the same body site, such as CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative or CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock, should this be required. In the situation where this archetype can only be used to name a large and/or non-specific body part, the additional use of the CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative archetype will support recording of a more precise location - for example, 2 cm anterior to the cubital fossa of the left forearm or 4 cm below R costal margin on the chest wall in the mid-clavicular line.

If this archetype is used within other archetypes where the specified subject of care is not the individual for whom the record is being created, for example a fetus in-utero, then the anatomical location will be identifying a body site on or within the fetus.
en.misuse: Not to be used for specifiying unilateral/bilateral occurrences of an anatomical feature.

nl.purpose: Om gestructureerde details over een structuur op of in het menselijk lichaam te identificeren en vast te leggen, in macroscopische anatomische termen.
nl.use: Gebruik om gestructureerde details over een structuur op of in het menselijk lichaam te identificeren en vast te leggen.
nl.misuse: Niet gebruiken om meerdere unilaterale/bilaterale structuren vast te leggen.

fr.purpose: Identifier et enregistrer des détails structurés concernant un site physique unique sur ou dans le corps humain en utilisant des termes anatomiques macroscopiques.
fr.use:
À utiliser pour enregistrer des détails structurés et cohérents sur un seul site physique identifié sur ou dans le corps humain. 

Cet archétype est spécifiquement conçu pour être utilisé dans le contexte des archétypes ENTRY ou CLUSTER appropriés qui fournissent le contexte de la localisation anatomique. 

En tant qu'élément fondamental de la pratique clinique, les cliniciens peuvent décrire les localisations anatomiques d'une myriade de façons complexes et variables. Dans la pratique, certains archétypes contiennent un seul élément de données pour une simple description du site corporel - par exemple, OBSERVATION.blood_pressure et CLUSTER.symptom pour la description d'une douleur à l'oreille. Dans cette situation, où l'ensemble des valeurs est prévisible et simple à définir, cet élément de données unique est un moyen très précis et pragmatique d'enregistrer le site dans le corps et de l'interroger à une date ultérieure. Toutefois, lorsque l'emplacement anatomique n'est pas bien défini ou doit être déterminé au moment de l'exécution, il peut être plus souple d'utiliser cet archétype structuré. Par exemple, lorsque n'importe quel symptôme peut être enregistré sans que le type de symptôme soit prédéfini, il peut être utile d'autoriser l'utilisation de cet archétype pour définir spécifiquement une localisation anatomique dans le corps. Dans ce cas, l'archétype CLUSTER.symptom comporte également un SLOT pour "Localisation anatomique détaillée", qui peut inclure cet archétype afin d'assurer une flexibilité maximale dans l'enregistrement des données relatives à la localisation anatomique.

Cet archétype permet d'enregistrer des sites anatomiques complexes et structurés. Par exemple, le battement de l'apex du cœur se trouve généralement au cinquième espace intercostal gauche sur la ligne médio-claviculaire, la sensibilité au point de McBurney sur la paroi abdominale ou une lacération sur la face palmaire de la partie proximale du pouce droit.

Une combinaison des éléments de données de cet archétype peut être utilisée pour enregistrer individuellement chaque composante d'une expression terminologique postcoordonnée représentant le site anatomique.

Le SLOT "Structure alternative" permet d'inclure des archétypes supplémentaires qui fournissent une structure alternative pour décrire le même site corporel, comme CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative ou CLUSTER.anatomical_location_clock, si cela s'avère nécessaire. Dans le cas où cet archétype ne peut être utilisé que pour nommer une partie du corps importante et/ou non spécifique, l'utilisation supplémentaire de l'archétype CLUSTER.anatomical_location_relative permettra d'enregistrer une localisation plus précise - par exemple, 2 cm en avant de la fosse cubitale de l'avant-bras gauche ou 4 cm en dessous du rebord costal R sur la paroi thoracique, au niveau de la ligne claviculaire médiane.

Si cet archétype est utilisé dans d'autres archétypes où le sujet de soins spécifié n'est pas la personne pour laquelle le dossier est créé, par exemple un fœtus in-utero, la localisation anatomique identifiera alors un site corporel sur ou dans le fœtus.
fr.misuse: Ne pas utiliser pour spécifier les occurrences unilatérales/bilatérales d'une caractéristique anatomique.

at0000.description: *A physical site on or within the human body.(en)

at0001.description: *Identification of a single physical site either on, or within, the human body.(en)
at0001.comment:
*This data element is the only mandated data point in this archetype and should be used as the primary data point to record an anatomical location with a commonly used name. It is strongly recommended that 'Body site name' be recorded as specifically as is anatomically possible. For example: record 'upper eyelid' rather than recording 'eyelid' with 'upper' as a qualifier; 'fifth rib' rather than 'rib' with a numeric qualifier. Use the other data elements for laterality, aspect, region and anatomical line to provide more detail.

This data element should be coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible - an appropriate termset for use here could comprise individual concepts or a list of precoordinated terms. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available.

If 'Body site name' is already identified in an archetype in which this Anatomical location archetype has been nested, then this data element may be redundant. However, it might be reasonable to duplicate 'Body site name' in this archetype to support semantic querying using this archetype, instead of the archetype in which it has been nested. (en)

at0002.description: *The side of the body on which the identified  body site is located.(en)
at0002.comment:
*If the identified body site has no laterality, this data element should not have a value. 
If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include laterality, then this data element is redundant.(en)

at0003.description: *Left side of the body.(en)

at0004.description: *Right side of the body.(en)

at0023.description: *Narrative description that can be used to further refine and support the 'Body site name'.(en)
at0023.comment: *For example: adjacent to the vermilion border; a tattoo covers the bottom half of this area.(en)

at0053.description: *Additional detail about the anatomical site using alternative approaches to describe the same body site.(en)
at0053.comment: *For example, relative location or precise locations using coordinates. (en)

at0054.description: *Image or other media used to support identification of the body site.(en)

at0055.description: *Additional detail using theoretical lines drawn through anatomical structures used to provide a consistent reference point on the human body.(en)
at0055.comment: *Common anatomical lines have been included as a value set, which can be extended over time, plus a free text option. The additional use of this data element allows for recording of the typical position of the heart's apex beat at 5th intercostal space, left side, and mid-clavicular line. If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include anatomical line, then this data element is redundant.(en)

at0056.description: *Line running vertically down the surface of the body, passing through the apex of the axilla.(en)

at0057.description: *Line running vertically down the surface of the body, passing through the anterior axillary skinfold.(en)

at0058.description: *Line running vertically down the surface of the body, passing through the posterior axillary skinfold.(en)

at0059.description: *Line running vertically down the surface of the body, parallel to the midline and passing through the midpoint of the clavicle.(en)

at0060.description: *Line running vertically down the face through the midpoint of the pupil when looking directly forward.(en)

at0062.description: *Line running vertically which divides the body into left and right portions, passing through the head, spinal cord, and umbilicus. Alternatively it can refer to a line dividing a body part into two equal portions, for example a digit.(en)

at0063.description: *Line running vertically down the posterior surface of the body, parallel to the midline and passing through the inferior point of the scapula.(en)

at0064.description: *Qualifying detail about the specific aspect of the identified body site.(en)
at0064.comment: *Use to increase precision of identification of the body site, if required. Common aspects have been included as a value set, which can be extended over time, plus a free text option. Assumes that the body is being described while in the anatomical position. For example: proximal urethra; plantar aspect of the left thumb. Multiple aspects can also be described, if required, by allowing for 0..2 occurrences. For example: a lesion may be on the left anterior/lateral (ie anterolateral) chest wall. If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include the aspect, then this data element is redundant.(en)

at0065.description: *Additional detail using a specific region or a point on, or within, the identified body site.(en)
at0065.comment:
*Use to increase precision of identification of the body site, if required. For example, the upper right quadrant or McBurney's point on the abdominal wall or interphalangeal joint of the great toe. If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include the specific site, then this data element is redundant.
In most situations this will be a single specific site. This data element has multiple occurrences to support less common use cases which need to identify a single anatomical location involving two or more adjacent and continuous specific sites. For example, to describe the specific site of a single tumour extending across the 2nd, 3rd and 4th ribs. (en)

at0067.description: *Towards the midline of the body site.(en)

at0068.description: *Towards the side, or edge, of the body site.(en)

at0069.description: *Above the body site, often meaning towards the head.(en)

at0070.description: *Below the body site, often meaning towards the feet.(en)

at0071.description: *Towards the front, or ventral surface, of  the body site.(en)

at0072.description: *Towards the back, or dorsal surface, of the body site.(en)

at0073.description: *More central or closer to the point of attachment, and usually describing part of a limb, digit or appendage.(en)

at0074.description: *More peripheral, or further from the point of attachment, and usually describing part of a limb, digit or appendage.(en)

at0075.description: *Towards the palm of the hand.(en)

at0076.description: *Towards the sole of the foot.(en)

at0077.description: *In the middle of the body site.(en)

at0078.description: *Towards the mouth. Usually used to describe locations within the digestive system.(en)

at0079.description: *Towards the anus. Usually used to describe locations within the digestive system.(en)

at0080.description: *Away from the surface of the body site.(en)

at0081.description: *Towards the surface of the body site.(en)

at0082.description: *Towards the back of the hand or top of the foot. To be used as opposites of palmar or plantar, not as a synonym of posterior.(en)

at0002.1.description: *The side of the body on which the identified  body site is located.(en)

*If the identified body site has no laterality, this data element should not have a value.

at0060.description: Line running vertically down the face through the midpoint of the pupil when looking directly forward.

at0062.description: Line running vertically which divides the body into left and right portions, passing through the head, spinal cord, and umbilicus. Alternatively it can refer to a line dividing a body part into two equal portions, for example a digit.

at0063.description: Line running vertically down the posterior surface of the body, parallel to the midline and passing through the inferior point of the scapula.

at0064.description: Qualifying detail about the specific aspect of the identified body site.
at0064.comment: Use to increase precision of identification of the body site, if required. Common aspects have been included as a value set, which can be extended over time, plus a free text option. Assumes that the body is being described while in the anatomical position. For example: proximal urethra; plantar aspect of the left thumb. Multiple aspects can also be described, if required, by allowing for 0..2 occurrences. For example: a lesion may be on the left anterior/lateral (ie anterolateral) chest wall. If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include the aspect, then this data element is redundant.

at0065.description: Additional detail using a specific region or a point on, or within, the identified body site.
at0065.comment:
Use to increase precision of identification of the body site, if required. For example, the upper right quadrant or McBurney's point on the abdominal wall or interphalangeal joint of the great toe. If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include the specific site, then this data element is redundant.
In most situations this will be a single specific site. This data element has multiple occurrences to support less common use cases which need to identify a single anatomical location involving two or more adjacent and continuous specific sites. For example, to describe the specific site of a single tumour extending across the 2nd, 3rd and 4th ribs.

at0067.description: Towards the midline of the body site.

at0068.description: Towards the side, or edge, of the body site.

at0069.description: Above the body site, often meaning towards the head.

at0070.description: Below the body site, often meaning towards the feet.

at0071.description: Towards the front, or ventral surface, of  the body site.

at0072.description: Towards the back, or dorsal surface, of the body site.

at0073.description: More central or closer to the point of attachment, and usually describing part of a limb, digit or appendage.

at0074.description: More peripheral, or further from the point of attachment, and usually describing part of a limb, digit or appendage.

at0075.description: Towards the palm of the hand.

at0076.description: Towards the sole of the foot.

at0077.description: In the middle of the body site.

at0078.description: Towards the mouth. Usually used to describe locations within the digestive system.

at0079.description: Towards the anus. Usually used to describe locations within the digestive system.

at0080.description: Away from the surface of the body site.

at0081.description: Towards the surface of the body site.

at0082.description: Towards the back of the hand or top of the foot. To be used as opposites of palmar or plantar, not as a synonym of posterior.

at0002.1.description: The side of the body on which the identified  body site is located.
at0002.1.comment:
If the identified body site has no laterality, this data element should not have a value. 
If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include laterality, then this data element is redundant.

at0055.1.description: Additional detail using theoretical lines drawn through anatomical structures used to provide a consistent reference point on the human body.
at0055.1.comment: Common anatomical lines have been included as a value set, which can be extended over time, plus a free text option. The additional use of this data element allows for recording of the typical position of the heart's apex beat at 5th intercostal space, left side, and mid-clavicular line. If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include anatomical line, then this data element is redundant.

at0000.1.description: A physical site on or within the human body.

at0065.1.description: Additional detail using a specific region or a point on, or within, the identified body site.
at0065.1.comment:
Use to increase precision of identification of the body site, if required. For example, the upper right quadrant or McBurney's point on the abdominal wall or interphalangeal joint of the great toe. If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include the specific site, then this data element is redundant.
In most situations this will be a single specific site. This data element has multiple occurrences to support less common use cases which need to identify a single anatomical location involving two or more adjacent and continuous specific sites. For example, to describe the specific site of a single tumour extending across the 2nd, 3rd and 4th ribs.

at0023.1.description: Narrative description that can be used to further refine and support the 'Body site name'.
at0023.1.comment: For example: adjacent to the vermilion border; a tattoo covers the bottom half of this area.

at0001.1.description: Identification of a single physical site either on, or within, the human body.
at0001.1.comment:
This data element is the only mandated data point in this archetype and should be used as the primary data point to record an anatomical location with a commonly used name. It is strongly recommended that 'Body site name' be recorded as specifically as is anatomically possible. For example: record 'upper eyelid' rather than recording 'eyelid' with 'upper' as a qualifier; 'fifth rib' rather than 'rib' with a numeric qualifier. Use the other data elements for laterality, aspect, region and anatomical line to provide more detail.

This data element should be coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible - an appropriate termset for use here could comprise individual concepts or a list of precoordinated terms. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available.

If 'Body site name' is already identified in an archetype in which this Anatomical location archetype has been nested, then this data element may be redundant. However, it might be reasonable to duplicate 'Body site name' in this archetype to support semantic querying using this archetype, instead of the archetype in which it has been nested.

at0064.1.description: Qualifying detail about the specific aspect of the identified body site.
at0064.1.comment: Use to increase precision of identification of the body site, if required. Common aspects have been included as a value set, which can be extended over time, plus a free text option. Assumes that the body is being described while in the anatomical position. For example: proximal urethra; plantar aspect of the left thumb. Multiple aspects can also be described, if required, by allowing for 0..2 occurrences. For example: a lesion may be on the left anterior/lateral (ie anterolateral) chest wall. If the 'Body site name' data element uses pre-coordinated terms that include the aspect, then this data element is redundant.

at0001.1.description: Angi om lesjonen er funnet i brystet eller i aksilleregionen.

at0002.1.description: Den identifiserte kroppssiden.
at0002.1.comment:
Designkommentar:
Denne trengs ikke vises. Mulig den ikke trenger å være med heller.

at0000.description: Et fysisk sted på eller inne i menneskekroppen.

at0001.description: Navngiving av et enkelt fysisk sted enten på eller i menneskekroppen.
at0001.comment:
Dette dataelementet er det eneste obligatoriske dataelementet i arketypen og bør brukes som det primære dataelementet for registrering av en anatomisk lokalisering. Det er sterkt anbefalt at "Navn på kroppssted" registreres så anatomisk spesifikt som mulig. For eksempel; registrer "øvre øyelokk" heller enn "øyelokk" med "øvre" som kvalifikator; "femte ribben" heller enn "ribben" med en numerisk kvalifikator. Bruk de andre dataelementene for lateralitet, aspekt, region og anatomisk linje for å gi mer detaljer. Dette dataelementet bør kodes med en terminologi som kan assistere beslutningsstøtte dersom mulig - en passende terminologi for bruk her kunne omfatte individuelle konsepter eller lister av prekoordinerte termer. Fritekst bør kun brukes hvis det ikke finnes en passende terminologi. 

Dersom navn på kroppssted er oppgitt i arketypen som denne arketypen er nøstet inn i, kan dette dataelementet være redundant. Imidlertid kan det være fornuftig å dobbeltregistrere navnet på kroppstedet for å støtte semantiske spørringer basert på denne arketypen i stedet for i arketypen den er nøstet inn i.

at0002.description: Den identifiserte kroppssiden.
at0002.comment: Hvis den identifiserte kroppssiden ikke har noen lateralitet, bør dette datalementet stå tomt. Hvis dataelementet "Navn på kroppsted" bruker prekoordinerte termer som inkluderer lateralitet, er dette dataelementet overflødig.

at0003.description: Venstre side av kroppen

at0004.description: Høyre side av kroppen.

at0023.description: Fritekstbeskrivelse som kan brukes for å ytterligere presisere og støtte "Navn på kroppsted".
at0023.comment: For eksempel: Tilgrensende til leppens overgang fra slimhinne til hud; en tatovering dekker nedre halvdel av dette området.

at0053.description: Tilleggsinformasjon om det anatomiske stedet ved bruk av alternativ tilnærming for å beskrive det samme kroppsstedet.
at0053.comment: For eksempel relativ lokalisering eller presis lokalisering ved bruk av koordinater.

at0054.description: Bilde eller annet medium brukt for å understøtte identifikasjonen av kroppsstedet.

at0055.description: Detaljer om det anatomiske stedet beskrevet med teoretiske linjer tegnet gjennom anatomiske strukturer til bruk som et konsistent referansepunkt.
at0055.comment: Vanlige anatomiske linjer er inkludert som verdisett som kan utvides over tid, i tillegg gis mulighet for å bruke fritekst. Ytterligere bruk av dette dataelementet tillater registrering av typiske steder for hjertetspisstøt ved 5. intercostalrom på venstre side i midtclaviculærlinjen. Hvis dataelementet "Navn på kroppsted" bruker prekoordinerte termer som inkluderer lateralitet, er dette dataelementet overflødig.

at0056.description: Linje som løper vertikalt ned langs overflaten av kroppen gjennom apex i aksillen.

at0057.description: En linje som løper vertikalt ned langs kroppsoverflaten, og passerer gjennom fremre aksillære hudfold.

at0058.description: En linje som løper vertikalt ned langs kroppsoverflaten, og passerer gjennom bakre aksillære hudfold.

at0059.description: En linje som løper vertikalt ned langs kroppsoverflaten parallelt med midtlinjen og passerer gjennom clavicelens midtpunkt.

at0060.description: En linje som løper vertikalt ned ansiktet gjennom midtpunktet av pupillen når man ser rett framover.

at0062.description: En linje som løper vertikalt og deler kroppen i en venstre og en høyre del, passerer gjennom hodet, spinal medulla og umbilicus. Alternativt kan det brukes som en delelinje av en kroppsdel, for eksempel en inndeling av en finger.

at0063.description: En linje som løper vertikalt ned langs ryggens overflate, parallelt med midtlinjen og passerer gjennom det inferiore punkt av skapula.

at0064.description: Spesifiserende detaljer om mer spesifikke aspekter ved det aktuelle kroppsstedet.
at0064.comment: Brukes til å øke presisjonen ved spesifisering av kroppsstedet, ved behov. Vanlige aspekter er blitt inkludert som et verdisett som kan utvides over tid, i tillegg til mulighet for å bruke fritekst. Elementet har som antagelse at kroppen blir beskrevet i den anatomiske posisjon. F.eks. proksimal uretra, plantart aspekt av venstre tommel. Flere aspekter kan også beskrives om det er nødvendig ved å åpne for opptil 2 forekomster. F.eks. venstre anterior/laterale (anteriolaterale) brystvegg. Hvis dataelementet "Navn på kroppsted" bruker prekoordinerte termer som inkluderer lateralitet, er dette dataelementet overflødig.

at0065.description: Ytterligere detaljer gitt ved hjelp av en spesifikk region eller et punkt på eller i det spesifiserte kroppsstedet.
at0065.comment: Brukes til å øke presisjonen ved spesifisering av kroppsstedet, dersom påkrevd. For eksempel den øvre høyre kvadranten eller McBurneys punkt på bukveggen, eller interfalangealleddet på stortåen. Dersom dataelementet "Navn på kroppssted" er registrert ved hjelp av prekoordinerte termer som omfatter det spesifikke stedet er dette dataelementet overflødig. I de fleste tilfeller vil dette være ett enkelt sted på kroppen. Dataelementet åpner for flere forekomster i de sjeldne tilfellene der man trenger å angi et spesifikt anatomisk sted som omfatter to eller flere sammenhengende spesifikke steder. For eksempel for å beskrive det spesifikke stedet en svulst strekker seg over andre, tredje og fjerde ribben.

at0067.description: Mot midtlinjen av kroppen.

at0068.description: Mot utsiden eller kanten av kroppen.

at0069.description: Over kroppssted, ofte menes mot hodet. Synonymt med "kranial".

at0070.description: Under kroppssted, ofte menes mot føttene. Synonymt med "kaudal".

at0071.description: Mot fronten eller ventrale overflaten av kroppsstedet.

at0072.description: Mot bakside eller mot den dorsale overflaten av kroppsstedet.

at0073.description: Mer sentralt eller tettere til festepunktet, beskriver vanligvis en del av et lem, finger eller vedheng.

at0074.description: Mer perifert eller lengre vekke fra festepunktet, beskriver vanligvis av en del av et lem, finger eller vedheng.

at0075.description: Mot håndflaten.

at0076.description: Mot fotsålen.

at0077.description: I midten av kroppsstedet.

at0078.description: Mot munnen. Brukes som regel til å beskrive lokaliseringer i fordøyelsessystemet.

at0079.description: Mot anus. Brukes som regel til å beskrive lokaliseringer i fordøyelsessystemet.

at0080.description: Bort fra overflaten av kroppsstedet.

at0081.description: Mot overflaten av kroppsstedet.

at0082.description: Mot håndbaken eller toppen av foten. Brukes som motsetning til palmar og plantar, ikke som synonym for posterior.

at0055.1.description: Detaljer om det anatomiske stedet beskrevet med teoretiske linjer tegnet gjennom anatomiske strukturer til bruk som et konsistent referansepunkt.
at0055.1.comment: Vanlige anatomiske linjer er inkludert som verdisett som kan utvides over tid, i tillegg gis mulighet for å bruke fritekst. Ytterligere bruk av dette dataelementet tillater registrering av typiske steder for hjertetspisstøt ved 5. intercostalrom på venstre side i midtclaviculærlinjen. Hvis dataelementet "Navn på kroppsted" bruker prekoordinerte termer som inkluderer lateralitet, er dette dataelementet overflødig.

at0000.1.description: Et fysisk sted på eller inne i menneskekroppen.
